page.title: 11ST.MARY'S AMERSHAM.
page.content: When the school was first built in 1870 it was only for boys who had to pay a penny a week for lessons.There were only 2 or 3 teachers. In the log book it says a boy had severe beating for dropping a live mouse in to the stove.A large bell hangs outside,but it is no longer used as its considered unsafe.The school has been added to overthe years,and now has about 260 pupils from 5 to 12 years. As well as the usual classrooms there is a music room, woodwork and pottery room and cloakrooms with showers.There are 2 playgrounds,a pond and a large open area with a special part allowed to go wild. The older children can cross the road to Barn Meadow after lunch to play,for games. The children go to St Mary's church in the town for their carol service.
